Whether that's the case here or it's just a display of irrepressible talent, the result is fantastic. The food and service are top notch and it's the kind of experience that you won't mind paying a little bit of a premium to have. Many many places charge far more for far less.
author: Ryan M.

description: I am sorry to say it but I have just eaten there and it is seriously overpriced. Everybody was nice and friendly, I have to give them that, but $50 chef's menu was just a little steep. The food was good, especially the egg with porridge and the coconut dessert... the other 3 courses were not that memorable... At the end of the night our bill including the tip was over $160 and I we just had a couple of glasses of wine and a beer... It was a little excessive for this cute, down to earth place.  I kind of wished we had spent this kind of money somewhere else... It was my birthday dinner and it was a tad disappointing but it was my choice and I made my own bed... Oh, well, there is always next year...  :(
author: ania w.

description: Definitely eat here. ..What I especially loved about my experience at Prubechu was the warm ambiance and the service. The food and beer were great too. The ambiance was slightly island like (not over the top) which in SF = JOY. The restaurant temperature was pleasantly cozy (not hot) - which I find rare in SF... I'm usually sitting in any SF restaurant freezing. But they closed the front door I could take off my jacket and I amazingly felt so comfortable. (As a girl in SF so often you go out and your whole outfit is just covered up by the coat you have to wear in order not to freeze!) The other warm thing they do is play this lovely fun music that puts you completely at ease. The service is perfect, friendly, efficient, relaxed. I'd recommend the Tinaktak (coconut braised beef, hand made pasta), or the tasting menu which looked amazing (hope to try it next time.) Also they have a delightful beer selection! And the plants and flower arrangements throughout the restaurant are also so cool. Thanks Prubechu!!
author: Cassia V.

description: I consider myself an expert when it comes to chamorro cuisine, why you ask...well more than likely because I am a chamorro, born in Vallejo, CA but raised on the island of Guam since I was 7 months old and since then I have had the pleasure of tasting, serving, cooking and of course eating our island cuisine.  By no small feat are many of the dishes simplistic, in fact preparation for much of what we eat is time consuming.  Prubechu has taken what is already great food and made it GRAND!  The succulent flavors from each dish burst out and compel you to want more.  As if the 5 course tasting menu was enough, NO!!!!.....we had to venture further into their simple but seductive and enticing menu and order more.  Then they top it off with ice cream and not Blue Bunny, Hagen Das or Bryers but their own, homemade....coconut candy and melon ice cream lightly sprinkled with salt that was made on Guam.  The sweet and salty totally blended well and made for the perfect end to the perfect dinner!  Btw....their service was pretty amazing too!
author: Edyth B.

description: Last night I had the pleasure of sampling the tasting menu.  I truly enjoyed each and every course.  I was amazed that one of the owners recognized me from a brief stop in about 6 months ago.  Such a great meal and a very knowledgeable informative staff.
author: Tiffany W.

description: This was hands down one of the best meals I've ever had in SF. So many unique and scrumptious flavors, incredibly attentive and personable service. My partner and I got one tasting menu and then an arepa and the shrimp ceviche dish, plus some tuba drinks which were very refreshing. I know embarrassingly little about Guam, but after meeting the team at the restaurant and tasting their amazing food, I am going to put it towards the top of my dream vacation list. I can't speak highly enough of this place!!
author: Justine M.

description:
went here for a friend's birthday. excited about the set courses. place is nice and quaint, owners are friendly and serve your tables personally.  

The first course was a soup that was beyond bland. corn undercooked and fish was dry. the next course was an egg I believe which was by far the best thing on the menu. it was covered in a kind of mayo/uni type sauce which definitely made it.  the rest of the food was highly forgettable. nothing stuck out. and the price for the tasting was not worth the flavors. 

I hate to be a hater, but the food just wasn't good. bland and boring. I will not be recommending this to any of my friends in the future. 

the owners though were incredibly nice and highly accommodating.
author: Ryan B.

description: My husband is Chamorro but I'm not. I've had homemade Chamorro food while on Guam and while I can tell you that the food at Prubechu is delicious I don't know how it rates with his grandma's cooking.  He was impressed...like teary-eyed he was so happy to be eating this food.  The menu is short so we ordered one of everything and loved every bite.  Friends have been e-mailing us articles from all over the country about this place and I genuinely cannot wait to take them all to dinner here. Delicious, authentic & beautifully presented.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Ann B.

description: I hesitate to write this review because this place is surprisingly fairly empty and you can get a seat last minute. We got the tasting menu and it was really really good. It was 5 or 6 dishes that were a total surprise-- they won't tell you she's of time what you'll get but they ask for any allergies or aversions. Our tasting was comprised of a flat bread, shrimp ceviche soup, chicken sausage and red rice, fried egg on a bed of housemate spam (this was so good-- it had a soy sauce and sesame glaze that was perfectly crystalized), braised beef and a tapioca coconut dessert. Oh and pretty much every dish has coconut as an ingredient, so if you don't like coconuts this isn't the place to go. The service was also great-- our waiter was really nice and patient as we asked a bunch of questions-- none of us knew anything about Guam cuisine. One downside is they only have beer and wine (don't think they have a liquor license?) so if you'll looking for a cocktail might need to go elsewhere. Also the food is on the pricier side for southeast Asian cuisine. An entree ranges from like 17 to 26.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Modest, small, restaurant with little in the way of frills in the Mission that executes an excellent culinary experience! We did the tasting menu, which was 5 (+1) courses of beautifully prepared, innovative dishes with complex flavors and techniques that made it so fun to eat and experience! Each dish engages all 5 of your senses. The menu changes frequently, and you kind of need to go in to see what they will be serving that day. There is also an a la carte menu, but the tastng menu will have completely different set of dishes. My only disappointment was the wine list -- but not going to knock the place for that since wine isn't a Guamian staple, and the food really does speak for itself.
author: Ana J.

description: Extremely satisfied. In the heart of the mission with a comfortable atmosphere. It's not too fancy and not too casual for a dinner. It's warm and inviting with decorations from the island. My boyfriend and I had the chefs tasting menu and enjoyed every dish. The price was very reasonable for 5 courses. The chefs did a great job of explaining every dish and the portions were perfect (especially for island food). Sitting at the bar, we had a chance to view a lot of other dishes and will be coming back to try it all. I recommend ordering a portion for each person of their dessert with coconut ice cream (made in house). I cannot wait for them to package that ice cream for retail! Glad to see this is a restaurant that's highlighting the best of Chamorro food.
author: J P.

description: I had a priceless experience at this truly unique restaurant!  The flavors delight the palate with layers of surprises.  We had an entertaining evening as well as an eating adventure -- scrumptious textures and exotic pairings.  Great attention to presentation elevated the simple flavors to a really artistic level.  I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant for a memorable dining experience.
author: Julie F.
